channel.title: Krim's Gallery
channel.description:
[b]Hello everyone. I just recently got involved into graphics designing (with a little help from this section)and I would like to start keeping my own gallery for art I create. I'll try to update this everyday, eventually organizing a huge library of arts specially designed by me.[/b]
Here is my first piece of art I've ever done with Photoshop, and since art is 100% creativity and imagination, I decided to use a theme that humans have dreamed about for centuries -- the novas:
[img]http://fc02.deviantart.net/fs70/f/2012/161/2/7/imagination_by_float4life-d530b2s.png[/img]
Tell me what you think; Also, if you have any suggestions to what future arts should be, please do discuss. :)

item.title: Krim's Gallery
item.dc:creator: @Mr_x1 Mr...x..
item.description:
@Mr_x1 wrote:

I like it, the red flare area attracts my attention, where as my attention should be automatically focused on the text. If you dim that down it would be fantastic.

Read full topic

item.title: Krim's Gallery
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

I really like this. The concept itself seems a bit simplistic, but it looks amazing.

Read full topic

item.title: Krim's Gallery
item.dc:creator: @Krim Krim
item.description:
@Krim wrote:

[quote=“CreatorAlex, post:8, topic:444525”]I feel like the red shouldn’t be so bright, overpowering the blue side.

Still looks awesome. Gj[/quote]
Art always has a different effect on each person. We all interpret things differently, even if the reasoning seems similar. To explain my reasoning for the brightness in a more scientific matter, brighter novas usually appear to be red because of the massive heat produced from them, as opposed to the blue nova’s cooler and more relaxed character.

I’ll try to get more pieces up, but I’ve been quite busy lately. Thanks for the great feedback so far!

Read full topic

Hello everyone. I just recently got involved into graphics designing (with a little help from this section)and I would like to start keeping my own gallery for art I create. I’ll try to update this everyday, eventually organizing a huge library of arts specially designed by me.

Here is my first piece of art I’ve ever done with Photoshop, and since art is 100% creativity and imagination, I decided to use a theme that humans have dreamed about for centuries – the novas:
